choices.A: Security requirements are added to software development processes.
choices.D: Repeatable software development procedures are established.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the PRIMARY benefit of benchmarking an organization’s software development life cycle practices against a capability maturity model?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The primary benefit of benchmarking an organization’s SDLC practices against a CMM is to establish a structured, repeatable process framework. While benefits like improved security, reliability, or efficiency may follow, they stem from the foundational goal of creating repeatable software development procedures.

questions.question_text: Which type of testing is used to identify security vulnerabilities in source code in the development environment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Based on this analysis, Static analysis security testing (SAST) (Option C) is the most appropriate choice. It directly analyzes the source code in the development environment, enabling developers to detect and fix security vulnerabilities early in the process.

questions.question_text: An IS auditor evaluating the change management process must select a sample from the change log. What is the BEST way for the auditor to confirm the change log is complete?

choices.D: Interview change management personnel about completeness.
choices.C: Take an item from the log and trace it back to the system.
choices.B: Take the last change from the system and trace it back to the log.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Here, the auditor identifies the most recent change made in the system and checks whether it is recorded in the change log. If the last change is present, it indicates that the log is being updated in a timely manner, suggesting that the change management process is capturing changes as they occur. While this doesn’t prove that every single change throughout the log’s history is recorded—since earlier entries could still have omissions—it provides a practical starting point. Confirming the latest change is logged offers some evidence that the process is functioning and current, which is a stronger indicator of completeness than reliance on statements alone.

B. Take the last change from the system and trace it back to the log.

This method ensures that the change log accurately reflects all changes made in the system. By tracing the last change from the system back to the log, the auditor can verify that the log is capturing all changes as they occur. C. Take an item from the log and trace it back to the system: This approach confirms that specific logged changes are valid but does not ensure that all changes are logged.

Selected Answer: B
B is the right answer

Selected Answer: C
This should be C, B just checks the most recent change whereas option C allows the auditor to check any changes giving a better sample selection into the change log.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the PRIMARY benefit of monitoring IT operational logs?

choices.C: Detecting processing errors in a timely manner
choices.A: Identifying configuration flaws in operating systems
choices.B: Generating exception reports to assess security compliance
choices.D: Managing the usability and capacity of IT resources

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In summary, while all options offer some value, detecting processing errors in a timely manner is the most essential and direct benefit of monitoring IT operational logs, ensuring systems remain operational and reliable.

Selected Answer: D
For an IS auditor reviewing access controls in a document management system, the most useful resource is a system-generated list of staff and their project assignments, roles, and responsibilities (Option D). It directly supports the core objective of verifying that access is appropriately assigned and controlled, making it the best choice among the options provided.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST useful to an IS auditor performing a review of access controls for a document management system?

choices.D: A system-generated list of staff and their project assignments, roles, and responsibilities
choices.B: Policies and procedures for managing documents provided by department heads
choices.A: Information provided by the audit team lead on the authentication systems used by the department
choices.C: Previous audit reports related to other departments’ use of the same system
